verses.kjv: These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.
verses.ct: These are additional proverbs of Solomon, compiled by the officials of King Hezekiah of Judah.

verses.kjv: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings is to search out a matter.
verses.ct: It is the glory of God to keep things hidden, but it is the honor of kings to investigate a matter thoroughly.

verses.kjv: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.
verses.ct: The heavens are high, the earth is deep, and the minds of kings are impossible to fathom.

verses.kjv: Take away the dross from the silver, and there shall come forth a vessel for the finer.
verses.ct: Remove the impurities from silver, and the silversmith can craft a fine vessel.

verses.kjv: Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.
verses.ct: Remove wicked people from the king's presence, and his throne will be secured through righteousness.

verses.kjv: Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great men:
verses.ct: Don't promote yourself in front of the king or position yourself among important people.

verses.kjv: For better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes have seen.
verses.ct: It's far better to be told, 'Come up here,' than to be humiliated by being moved to a lower place in front of a noble you've seen with your own eyes.

verses.kjv: Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.
verses.ct: Don't rush into a legal dispute, because what will you do at the end of it when your neighbor has embarrassed you?

verses.kjv: Debate thy cause with thy neighbour himself; and discover not a secret to another:
verses.ct: Settle your disagreement directly with your neighbor, and don't reveal someone else's secret in the process.

verses.kjv: Lest he that heareth it put thee to shame, and thine infamy turn not away.
verses.ct: Otherwise, whoever hears about it will shame you, and your ruined reputation will never recover.

verses.kjv: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.
verses.ct: The right word at the right time is like golden apples set in a silver frame.

verses.kjv: As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.
verses.ct: Like a gold ring or a piece of fine gold jewelry — that's what wise correction is to someone willing to listen.

verses.kjv: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters.
verses.ct: Like the coolness of snow during harvest time, a trustworthy messenger refreshes the soul of those who sent him.

verses.kjv: Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift is like clouds and wind without rain.
verses.ct: Someone who brags about a gift they never give is like clouds and wind that produce no rain.

verses.kjv: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.
verses.ct: Through patience, even a ruler can be persuaded, and a gentle tongue can break through the hardest resistance.

verses.kjv: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.
verses.ct: If you find honey, eat only what you need — otherwise you'll have too much and throw it up.

verses.kjv: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour’s house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee.
verses.ct: Don't visit your neighbor's house too often, or they'll get tired of you and start to resent you.

verses.kjv: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour is a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.
verses.ct: Someone who gives false testimony against a neighbor is as dangerous as a club, a sword, or a razor-sharp arrow.

verses.kjv: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.
verses.ct: Relying on an unreliable person in a crisis is like chewing with a broken tooth or walking on a dislocated foot.

verses.kjv: As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.
verses.ct: Singing cheerful songs to someone with a heavy heart is like stripping off their coat in freezing weather or pouring vinegar on an open wound.

verses.kjv: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:
verses.ct: If your enemy is hungry, give him food to eat, and if he is thirsty, give him water to drink.

verses.kjv: For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and the LORD shall reward thee.
verses.ct: By doing this, you will pile burning coals on his head, and the LORD will reward you.

verses.kjv: The north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.
verses.ct: Just as a north wind brings rain, a gossip's tongue brings angry looks.

verses.kjv: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman and in a wide house.
verses.ct: It's better to live in a corner on the rooftop than to share a spacious house with a quarrelsome wife.

verses.kjv: As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.
verses.ct: Good news from a distant land is like cold water to a thirsty soul.

verses.kjv: A righteous man falling down before the wicked is as a troubled fountain, and a corrupt spring.
verses.ct: When a righteous person gives in to the wicked, it's like a muddied spring or a polluted well.

verses.kjv: It is not good to eat much honey: so for men to search their own glory is not glory.
verses.ct: Eating too much honey isn't good for you, and chasing after your own honor isn't honorable either.

verses.kjv: He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls.
verses.ct: A person with no self-control is like a city with broken-down walls and no defenses.
